intro: Phyllanthus lebrunii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in compact clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, facilitating its dispersal in the natural environment.
